The meaning is both below.
This is the correct meaning.

source_sentence: 謂七識緣境之時相應心所唯一十八。
translation: The only 18 mental factors that are associated with the seven consciousnesses when they're cognized by an object are the seven mental factors.
It means that beyond the four disturbances, there are only the five universal activities.
There are only the five pervasive mental functions.
The wisdom that's specific to an object.
The great followers are the eight.
There are no other mental factors.
It's simply distinguished as before.
And there are three texts in the śāstra.
The first text of the Yogâcārabhūmi-śāstra establishes five followers.
The second text of the Yoga posits six derivative aspects and ten derivative aspects.
They're also in accord with the previous explanation.
Discourse on the Theory of Consciousness-only, Vol. 4
